meaning_str.bing:
n. 危机；危急关头；危难时刻；病危期
网络. 转折点；决定性时刻；紧要关头

危机；危急关头；危难时刻；病危期
转折点；决定性时刻；紧要关头

危机；紧要关头；危急时刻；转折点；危难时期

1.en: Mr Park seems to have fallen foul of both the two main causes of official paranoia: the internet and the financial crisis.
1.cn: 而朴大成似乎是因为撞在政府的2根软肋——因特网和经济危机上才导致纠纷缠身。

2.en: The Prime Minister has led us steadfastly, and with admirable fortitude, as our national anchor in a time of crisis.
2.cn: 首相作为这次危机中的“国家之锚”，以其令人钦佩的刚毅，坚定地引导着我们。

3.en: more dreams will be deferred and denied. and our nation will sink deeper into a crisis that, at some point, we may not be able to reverse.
3.cn: 就会有更多的家庭失去自己的储蓄，就会有更多的梦想被推迟、被粉碎。我们的国家就会在危机中陷得更深。到了某个时候，我们可能就无法扭转局面了。

0.en: The grasses had found a way to survive the crisis.
0.cn: 草类找到了应对危机的好办法。

1.en: I'm loyal, I'm trustworthy, and I'm good in a crisis.
1.cn: 我很忠诚，值得信赖，并且在危机之时能挺身而出。

2.en: It's important to understand because it's what allowed a housing crisis to become a nationwide economic disaster.
2.cn: 这是很重要的概念，因为它会让房地产危机成为全国金融危机。

3.en: They were together in Cuba the day of the crisis in 1962.
3.cn: 在1962年的古巴危机中，他们一起出现了。

4.en: I know you, Lane. Somewhere along the line you had a crisis of faith.
4.cn: 我了解你，莱恩，一直徘徊在道德边界，你有了信仰危机。

5.en: It's okay. I do. Look, Leonard is helping Sheldon through a family crisis.
5.cn: 没关系，我来说，莱纳德其实在帮谢尔顿解决家庭危机。

6.en: Ross honey, this is very nice, but I got a crisis. Yeah, but I got couscous.
6.cn: 亲爱的，你很体帖，但我现在有危机。但我现在有蒸丸子。

7.en: Our nation was recovering from a political scandal and a trade crisis with China.
7.cn: 我国正在从一起政治丑闻和与中国的贸易危机中走出来。

8.en: Why? She wasn't much help during the Russia crisis. She closed the deal with Petrov.
8.cn: 为什么？俄国危机期间她没帮上什么忙。可是她和佩特罗夫达成了协议。

9.en: The six years since the financial crisis have demanded hard work and sacrifice on everyone's part.
9.cn: 自金融危机以来的六年，需要的是每一个人的辛勤工作和牺牲。

10.en: I talked about our collective strength, black and white, coming together during times of crisis.
10.cn: 我提到了我们集体的力量，无论是黑人还是白人，在危机时刻走到一起。

11.en: We've gone from losing 9 million jobs during the financial crisis to creating 10 million jobs.
11.cn: 我们从金融危机时的900万人失业到今天创造出1000万个就业岗位。

12.en: Okay, listen, I know that you're having a bit of a family crisis but you don't have to take it out on the plates.
12.cn: 好了，我知道你现在正在经历家庭危机，但是你不需要把气出在盘子身上。

13.en: And so, Thanksgiving, Christmas, and half of January have come and gone, and all three branches of government are in crisis.
13.cn: 就这样，感恩节，圣诞节，再加上半个一月来了又去，政府的三大分支全都深陷危机。

14.en: You may not, at any point, suggest that there is any form of crisis. If you do, I will end this session and her life. Are we clear?
14.cn: 通话期间不得暗示现在有危机情况，不然我就立马终止这一关和她的生命。明白了吗？

15.en: When the President and I took office in January of 2009, this nation was in the midst of the greatest economic crisis since the great depression.
15.cn: 2009年1月，在总统和我主政之初，全国正深陷自大萧条以来最严重的经济危机之中。

16.en: Small business owners have had to overcome a lot these past several years. We all saw local businesses close their doors during the crisis.
16.cn: 中小企业主在过去的这些年里克服了种种困难。我们也看到了，在经济危机期间，大量地方企业关门歇业。

17.en: Nearly six years after the worst financial crisis of our lifetimes our businesses have added nearly 10 million new jobs over the past 53 months.
17.cn: 六年前,我们遭遇了此生最严重的经济危机，经过53个月的努力，我们的企业已经创造了将近1000万个就业岗位。

18.en: They've been supporting our efforts in West Africa to fight the Ebola epidemic and save lives, because in times of crisis and challenge the world turns to America for leadership.
18.cn: 他们也曾经支持我们在西非战胜埃博拉疫情并拯救生命的努力，因为在危机和挑战之时，世界寻求着美国的领导。

19.en: What's up? I'll tell you what's up. I'm in a crisis situation.
19.cn: 怎么了？我来告诉你怎么了，我现在性命交关。
